description: Improvised tool recipes and configuration for the Improvised Tool Crafting subsystem

toolRecipes.description: Bend scrap metal into thin shims that slip between lock pins, allowing manipulation without proper lockpicks.

flavorText.success: After careful work, you've fashioned a serviceable set of shim picks. They're rough around the edges but functional.
flavorText.criticalSuccess: Your hands move with practiced precision. The shim picks are of exceptional quality—they'll serve you well.
flavorText.failure: The metal shards won't cooperate, breaking apart as you work. Your materials are lost.
flavorText.fumble: A sharp edge catches you off guard—pain lances through your hand. The components are ruined.

toolRecipes.description: A carefully wrapped probe of copper wire attached to an insulated handle, used to manipulate exposed terminal circuits.

flavorText.success: You've fashioned a serviceable wire probe. The handle provides just enough insulation for careful work.
flavorText.criticalSuccess: The probe is perfectly balanced with precise wire wrapping—a quality tool for delicate terminal work.
flavorText.failure: The wire keeps slipping, refusing to wrap correctly. Your components are wasted.
flavorText.fumble: A spark arcs between the wires, burning your fingers. The components are destroyed.

toolRecipes.description: A crude device that emits an electromagnetic pulse pattern known to induce glitched states in Old World machinery.

specialEffect.name: Force Glitch State
specialEffect.details: When activated on a non-glitched mechanism, the mechanism becomes [Glitched] for 1d4+1 rounds. This enables Glitch Exploitation bypass method (-4 DC) but also adds +2 DC from [Glitched] state.

flavorText.success: The glitch trigger crackles with unstable energy. It's ready to corrupt machinery on command.
flavorText.criticalSuccess: You've built a remarkably stable glitch trigger—it will induce glitches reliably and safely.
flavorText.failure: The capacitor discharges prematurely, frying the wire connections. Nothing remains.
flavorText.fumble: The capacitor explodes in your hands! Electric burns and fragments of wire cut deep.

toolRecipes.description: Spring-loaded metal clips that physically bypass the outer access layer of a terminal, connecting directly to inner circuits.

specialEffect.name: Skip Layer 1
specialEffect.details: When used on terminal hacking, automatically passes Layer 1 (Access) and starts infiltration at Layer 2 (Authentication). Saves time and eliminates Layer 1 failure risk.

flavorText.success: The bypass clamps are functional. They'll grip terminal circuits firmly enough for a clean bypass.
flavorText.criticalSuccess: These clamps have perfect spring tension—they'll connect securely and bypass terminals with ease.
flavorText.failure: The clips won't hold their shape, bending out of alignment. Your metal is wasted.
flavorText.fumble: A clip snaps violently, sending metal fragments flying. Your hands pay the price.

tinkersToolkit.description: Having [Tinker's Toolkit] grants +1d10 to crafting checks.

workshopAccess.description: Being in a proper workshop grants +2d10 to crafting checks.

underPressure.description: Being under time pressure or in hostile environment causes -1d10 to crafting checks.

toolDurability.description: Standard tools have 3 uses, quality tools have 5. Fumble while using a tool breaks it immediately.

criticalSuccess.description: Net successes >= 5 creates a quality version of the tool with +2d10 bonus and 5 uses.

fumbleConsequences.description: On fumble, components are destroyed and crafter takes 1d6 damage from sparks and metal fragments.
